vague_description: Finding the optimal number of demonstrations to maximize foam production while staying within ingredient and byproduct constraints.
detailed_description: A science show performs two different demonstrations, demonstration 1 and demonstration 2. In demonstration 1, \param{MintD1} units of mint and \param{ActiveD1} units of the active ingredient is used to make \param{FoamD1} units of minty foam. In demonstration 2, \param{MintD2} units of mint and \param{ActiveD2} units of the active ingredient is used to make \param{FoamD2} units of minty foam. In addition, demonstration 1 creates \param{TarD1} units of black tar while demonstration 2 creates \param{TarD2} units of black tar. The show has available \param{TotalMint} units of mint and \param{TotalActive} units of active ingredients. If at most \param{MaxTar} units of black tar can be produced, how many of each demonstration should be done to maximize the amount of minty foam produced?
target_objective: Maximize the total amount of minty foam produced from both demonstrations
target_constraints: Total used units of mint for Demonstration 1 and Demonstration 2 cannot exceed TotalMint
Total used units of the active ingredient for Demonstration 1 and Demonstration 2 cannot exceed TotalActive
Total produced units of black tar from Demonstration 1 and Demonstration 2 cannot exceed MaxTar
target_parameters: Units of mint used in demonstration 1
Units of mint used in demonstration 2
Units of active ingredient used in demonstration 1
Units of active ingredient used in demonstration 2
Units of minty foam produced in demonstration 1
Units of minty foam produced in demonstration 2
Units of black tar produced in demonstration 1
Units of black tar produced in demonstration 2
Total available units of active ingredient
Maximum allowable units of black tar to be produced
